.class public auto ansi sealed WebPartDisplayModeCancelEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub WebPartDisplayModeCancelEventHandler(sender As Object, e As WebPartDisplayModeCancelEventArgs)
public delegate void WebPartDisplayModeCancelEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, WebPartDisplayModeCancelEventArgs ^ e);
type WebPartDisplayModeCancelEventHandler = delegate of obj * WebPartDisplayModeCancelEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that handles the event of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The method specified in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDisplayModeCancelEventHandler> delegate is called when a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.DisplayModeChanging> event is raised.
Page developers can provide custom handlers for Web Parts events by adding an `OnDisplayModeChanging` attribute to the `<asp:webpartmanager>` element in a page, and assigning a custom method name to the attribute. A custom handler can also be assigned programmatically. For more information about how to subscribe to an event, see [How to: Raise and Consume Events](/dotnet/standard/events/how-to-raise-and-consume-events).
